entry.title: Concerto Barocco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although George Balanchine incorporated jazz dance-inspired choreography in his ballet Concerto Barocco (pictured), those elements are now gone?

entry.title: Amdek Corporation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Amdek Corporation, a popular manufacturer of computer monitors in the 1980s, started out as a reseller of car radio components?

entry.title: Lauren Jenkins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before pursuing a career in music, Lauren Jenkins was the host of a wrestling television show?

entry.title: Sora ga Suki! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the manga series Sora ga Suki! depicted two male characters kissing each other although it was a taboo for manga in the 1970s?

entry.title: 2020 Colonial Pipeline oil spill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2020 Colonial Pipeline oil spill was discovered by two teenagers?

entry.title: W. A. F. J. Tumbelaka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that W. A. F. J. Tumbelaka once expelled his children from the University of Indonesia after they failed to pass an evaluation?

entry.title: the first episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that three blocks near Stampede Park were transformed into a destroyed city for the first episode of The Last of Us?

entry.title: Barclay Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wine cellar of New York City's Barclay Hotel is on the second floor?
